intro: Pelea hualalaiensis, commonly known as the Hualalai pelea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pelea hualalaiensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
